headline: Mandel allies urge Trump Ohio rally boycott after Vance GOP Senate endorsement
author: Kate Scanlon
sentences:
He is our best chance for victory in what could be a very tough race.?
But some Ohio Republicans argued Trump made the wrong call, marking one of his most contentious endorsements of the election cycle among his own party.

Just In...
COLUMBUS, Ohio  Allies of Ohio Republican Senate candidate Josh Mandel are calling for a boycott of a rally to be held by former President Donald Trump in the state after he endorsed Mandels primary rival, J.D.
Some Republicans in the state asked Trump to reconsider his endorsement, arguing in a letter that Vance is a political chameleon? who called Trump and his supporters racist? in 2016.
A large field of Republican candidates had sought Trumps endorsement before he ultimately gave it to Vance, a venture capitalist and author of Hillbilly Elegy, last week.
The group Ohio Value Voters, which endorsed Mandel, recently argued in a message to supporters that Republicans should boycott Trumps rally in protest of the endorsement.
However, if you decide to attend, when President Trump introduces JD Vance, make your voices heard by letting Trump know, JD Vance is Wrong for Ohio,? the message says.
Vance and several Republican House candidates also endorsed by Trump are scheduled to appear at a rally with the former president in Delaware County on Saturday.
Vance may have said some not-so-great things about me in the past, but he gets it now, and I have seen that in spades,? Trump said.
The message calls the endorsement of Vance a terrible decision? and blames unnamed people around the former president for it.
In his endorsement of Vance, Trump acknowledged his previous criticism, saying it was not an easy? decision for him to make.

Booing is entirely appropriate!?
Vance this week unveiled a new TV ad campaign touting Trumps endorsement.
In his Senate campaign, Vance has cast himself as a close ally to Trump.
Trump fought back, and so have I,? Vance says in the ad.
Now Ill take our fight to the U.S. Senate.?
